commit_message:
Add "idp-discovery-service-url" option

Allow the usage of an IDP discovery service for multiple IDPs.
Make use of "MellonDiscoveryURL" option in "mod_auth_mellon"
Apache module.

Change-Id: I2eed6dc3c57a51ed12f8ca4b31b46a13bc8fa911
Signed-off-by: Yanos Angelopoulos <yanos@admin.grnet.gr>
(cherry picked from commit e2a2ca2152d26530dc32334ea5325beb1c8bada7)

commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to Zadara VPSA Driver

Add IPv6 alongside IPv4 Storage Array connectivity.
This change will allow the user to use IPv6 for control and data path.

Change-Id: Ifa197eb9494aeaaa1b6044a140b45fce13a97104

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 01:01:12.000000000', 'message': '[nova] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I1ceed4b21261e36f2bae171e6f224dfba6a76838
'}]
commit_message:
[nova] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I1ceed4b21261e36f2bae171e6f224dfba6a76838

commit_message:
Pass verbose boolean value to wait_for_stack_ready()

Though it works, it's better to pass boolean value to avoid
confusion with the nested_depth parameter.

Change-Id: I4b40356413c201314bf859dd4141bf995aac4965

subject: Release devstack-tools 1.0.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-29 15:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-02 16:38:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM to release a major version related to the drop of py2 support, however I've some concern related to the pre-1.0 version that's actually in use in devstack-tools, are you sure is it ok for us to release a major version here?

I don't think it's an issue in the devstack context since if I'm right it's only used by devstack, but the current version show us a non stable product with possible significant future changes that may occur on the API that could be an issue for consumers of devstack-tools, so I prefer warn about this.

Only +1 for now by waiting PTL approval and discuss related to my previous concern."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-04 00:40:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I think this is good. Will wait to approve so Herve's question is answered."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-03-04 01:33:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> LGTM to release a major version related to the drop of py2 support,
 > however I've some concern related to the pre-1.0 version that's
 > actually in use in devstack-tools, are you sure is it ok for us to
 > release a major version here?
 > 
 > I don't think it's an issue in the devstack context since if I'm
 > right it's only used by devstack, but the current version show us a
 > non stable product with possible significant future changes that
 > may occur on the API that could be an issue for consumers of
 > devstack-tools, so I prefer warn about this.
 > 
 > Only +1 for now by waiting PTL approval and discuss related to my
 > previous concern.

This is used by many projects including python client and other repo. I do not think we will be doing any breaking improvement on this. There are not mcuh maintainer for this and I will just keep this as it is with bug fixes if something stop working. 

major version release is ok on this."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-03-04 11:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-17 21:46:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect instance state after build failure

The primary purpose of this change was to add a regression test for
bug 1831771. However, this regression test highlighted another bug in
cleanup after build failure which is therefore fixed in this change.

It is possible that the instance object was in an inconsistent state
at the point in the build process where an exception was raised,
containing unsaved changes. As we call instance.save() in both
_cleanup_allocated_networks and _set_instance_obj_error_state(), those
unsaved changes would be persisted during cleanup. This is always
wrong, but in the case of UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError
specifically this would mean explicitly saving the ACTIVE vm_state,
even though an error was raised and we didn't finish building.

We could also explicitly set the ERROR state for
UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError, but we don't because we expect that
we're currently executing delete, and this could potentially race with
the delete.

Change-Id: Ief1dfbb6cc9d67b73dfab4c7b63358e76e12866b
"}, {'created': '2019-10-18 09:55:13.000000000', 'message': 'Functional test for UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError

commit_message:
Functional test for UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError

Adds a regression-style test for two cleanup bugs when
'UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError' is raised during build.

Change-Id: Ief1dfbb6cc9d67b73dfab4c7b63358e76e12866b
Related-Bug: #1848666
Related-Bug: #1831771

commit_message:
Add a unit test for @tx_cached and fix a bug in it

* Added a unit tests for the decorator @tx_cached. The tests
  helped find a bug in the implementation. One of the conditions
  in the decorator was wrong.

Closes-Bug: #1864823

commit_message:
Bracket IPv6 address in ironic_inspector healthcheck

When using an IPv6 provisioning address, the address must be
bracketed for the ironic_inspector healthcheck.

In addition clean up other healthchecks to use this common
function when an address is used.

Closes-Bug: #1862845
Change-Id: Ifb67ebebed55e2d883a1e94cb4627f55d3a7383e

commit_message:
Make PrettyTable optional

PrettyTable as a depend can have a tendency to conflict with other
things that want to use it, which is a shame for a general purpose
library like futurist. Make it optional to reduce the transitive
dependency burden for consumers.

Change-Id: Ie976f7f4e544f273fccf0cf579b82b659cbd48d1

[{'created': '2020-02-27 16:46:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add setfacl statements for neutron metadata proxy

Statements to setfacl on fast forward upgrade were added for the l3
agent container and the neutron dhcp container.  But they are missing
from the metadata proxy container, which can lead to this sort of thing
after an FFU upgrade - but not immediately, waiting for the metadata
container to restart.  After restarting neutron_metadata_agent, the permission will be changed as follows.

  [root@overcloud-controller-0 neutron]# ll
  total 24
  drwxrwxr-x+ 2 42435 42435    6 Jun 18 08:57 dhcp
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  998 Jun 18 08:43 dhcp_haproxy_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1099 Jun 18 08:43 dibbler_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  995 Jun 18 08:43 dnsmasq_wrapper
  drwxrwxr-x+ 2 42435 42435    6 Jun 18 08:59 ha_confs
  srwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435    0 Jun 20 02:23 keepalived-state-change
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1035 Jun 18 08:43 keepalived_state_change_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1076 Jun 18 08:43 keepalived_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  996 Jun 18 08:43 l3_haproxy_wrapper
  srw-rwxr--+ 1 42435 42435    0 Jun 20 02:24 metadata_proxy
  [root@overcloud-controller-0 neutron]# getfacl metadata_proxy
  # file: metadata_proxy
  # owner: 42435
  # group: 42435
  user::rw-
  user:neutron:rwx
  group::r-x
  mask::rwx
  other::r--

  [root@overcloud-controller-0 neutron]# docker restart neutron_metadata_agent
  neutron_metadata_agent
  [root@overcloud-controller-0 neutron]# ll
  total 24
  drwxrwxr-x+ 2 42435 42435    6 Jun 18 08:57 dhcp
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  998 Jun 18 08:43 dhcp_haproxy_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1099 Jun 18 08:43 dibbler_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  995 Jun 18 08:43 dnsmasq_wrapper
  drwxrwxr-x+ 2 42435 42435    6 Jun 18 08:59 ha_confs
  srwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435    0 Jun 20 02:23 keepalived-state-change
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1035 Jun 18 08:43 keepalived_state_change_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1076 Jun 18 08:43 keepalived_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  996 Jun 18 08:43 l3_haproxy_wrapper
  srw-r--r--+ 1 42435 42435    0 Jun 20 02:29 metadata_proxy
  [root@overcloud-controller-0 neutron]# getfacl metadata_proxy
  # file: metadata_proxy
  # owner: 42435
  # group: 42435
  user::rw-
  user:neutron:rwx                #effective:r--
  group::r-x                      #effective:r--
  mask::r--
  other::r--

Change-Id: Idec372ae008cab9b27bd1ddc79b6b50c1de98563
(cherry picked from commit 107efc1f5ef2da7def754ae30019fb5eacf2f7f7)

commit_message:
Add setfacl statements for neutron metadata proxy

Statements to setfacl on fast forward upgrade were added for the l3
agent container and the neutron dhcp container.  But they are missing
from the metadata proxy container, which can lead to this sort of thing
after an FFU upgrade - but not immediately, waiting for the metadata
container to restart.  After restarting neutron_metadata_agent, the permission will be changed as follows.

  [root@overcloud-controller-0 neutron]# ll
  total 24
  drwxrwxr-x+ 2 42435 42435    6 Jun 18 08:57 dhcp
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  998 Jun 18 08:43 dhcp_haproxy_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435 1099 Jun 18 08:43 dibbler_wrapper
  -rwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435  995 Jun 18 08:43 dnsmasq_wrapper
  drwxrwxr-x+ 2 42435 42435    6 Jun 18 08:59 ha_confs
  srwxrwxr-x+ 1 42435 42435    0 Jun 20 02:23 keepalived-state-change

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-27 21:36:36.000000000', 'message': '[DNM]\xa0DHCPv6 - Use addr6_list in dnsmasq

Adds a new bool option dnsmasq_enable_addr6_list, when
enabled configuration for dnsmasq will be created with a
single dhcp-host entry specifying a list of ip addresses
allocated for a port and subnet.

Previously the dnsmasq dhcp-agent driver would write a
separate dhcp-host entry for each fixed-ip of a port in
the dnsmasq hosts file. The result of the previous
behaviour is that dnsmasq will only use one of the config
entries, i.e the first one matching the mac identifier.

The trade-off is that only a single dns_assignment will
be used for IPv6 addresses within the same subnet. (But
in practice, this was always the case since only the
first config entry would be used by dnsmasq.)

Why is this neccecary:
  This is done to enable ironic provisioning over IPv6
  using DHCPv6-stateful. For background info, please
  read dnsmasq-discuss thread:
http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q1/thread.html#13671

Change-Id: I833840e7daed2efa7efaece27cfd1ba28e0feb90

commit_message:
DHCPv6 - Use addr6_list in dnsmasq

Adds a new bool option dnsmasq_enable_addr6_list, when
enabled configuration for dnsmasq will be created with a
single dhcp-host entry specifying a list of ip addresses
allocated for a port.

Previously the dnsmasq dhcp-agent driver would write a
separate dhcp-host entry for each fixed-ip of a port in
the dnsmasq hosts file. The result of the previous
behaviour is that dnsmasq will only use one of the config
entries, i.e the first one matching the mac identifier.

The trade-off is that only a single dns_assignment will
be used for IPv6 addresses within the same subnet. (But
in practice, this was always the case since only the
first config entry would be used by dnsmasq.)

Why is this neccecary:
  This is done to enable ironic provisioning over IPv6
  using DHCPv6-stateful. For background info, please
  read dnsmasq-discuss thread:
http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q1/thread.html#13671

Closes-Bug: #1861032
Change-Id: I833840e7daed2efa7efaece27cfd1ba28e0feb90

commit_message:
Use ipc:host for cinder-backup

This was correctly configured in the pacemaker version of the
cinder-backup container but not in the non-pacemaker version.

Closes-Bug: 1864826
Change-Id: I3f9452d545783a6756662cbe06a3c91e92b46e61

commit_message:
Add replication_probe_interval for ovsdbs

Add posibilities to configure replication_probe_interval for ovsdb-server.
It configure probe interval for connection for ovsdb-server when it is
in backup mode and connects to the active ovsdb-server for replication

Change-Id: I6e5af0cfc00778e251bae0fc42c116a24c8fabc3

subject: Add cycle-highlight to puppet-keystone

Keep in mind the highlights are by team, not by deliverable. So this will get compiled together with any other highlights in Puppet OpenStack deliverables.

Ideally we want 3-5 key highlights per team. commit_message:
Add cycle-highlight to puppet-keystone

The puppet-keystone module went through a big change
where the usage of the legacy admin token isn't required
anymore and it can be bootstrapped using a admin password. [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692664/

Change-Id: Ie6b7df0260e62047d5b5cd2073583cb7fe8523a7

commit_message:
Remove wsgi_enabled parameters in nova

Now wsgi_enabled parameters in puppet-tripleo are removed and we always
use wsgi to deploy nova-api and nova-metadata-api.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710642/

commit_message:
Improve log message on exception for invalid tunnel type

When a tunnel with an invalid or unsupported type is to be created an
exception is raised but does not contain info for the offending host.
Add the host info and tunnel ip address to the exception error message
for better debugging

Change-Id: Id989f20043c252ff61ab9a6ee227e8c9c7c5029b
Closes-Bug: #1863888

[{'account_id': 31618, 'date': '2020-02-14 10:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-02-14 10:42:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 20284, 'date': '2020-02-14 10:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

subject: Add deprecation notes to vmware/xenserver/hyperv guides
messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 15:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 15:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 15:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think a direct reference in the documentation makes sense. New users will probably not read the deprecation notes first.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 15:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-03 16:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Good thinking Christian, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-03 16:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Good catch!

I would phrase it more along the lines "it's deprecated now and will be removed".

PS: no need to touch ansible/ files - let's avoid full CI'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 17:47:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I also placed the hint in the ansible files so that someone who doesn't read the documentation but only takes the globals.yml/all.yml will see the hint. So we are on the safe side and don't end up with someone who has accidentally used it after all."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 17:48:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

About the wording, should it still be changed or can it stay as it is? I listed Victoria explicitly because that's how it appears in the deprecation notes."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-03 17:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

etc/globals.yml is fine, it's ignored. The ansible/ is not.
We officially support only globals.yml descriptions, the real part is hidden.

As for wording... "deprecation notes" not having word start with "deprec" are kinda something else. :-)'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 18:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-03-03 18:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Better this way?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-03 18:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

TYVM!'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-04 09:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Add deprecation notes to vmware/xenserver/hyperv guides

The support of vmware, xenserver and hyperv was deprecated.

commit_message:
Refactor validate_ports function

Since 1.28 is ancient and all the stable branches have support
for `get_node_vifs` let's remove the unnecessary check.

Change-Id: I5b619321be876e04f4b29dce083ca0cc80c4ed5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 16:50:01.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: stop admin_password information leakage

A very mild information leakage in certain cases where we return
a policy violation error rather than instance not found.

This gives us consistent return errors between old and new policy
rule systems.

Change-Id: Ibd455be313322472b518434393b3d0b1b1bb860a
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: stop admin_password information leakage

A very mild information leakage in certain cases where we return
a policy violation error rather than instance not found.

This gives us consistent return errors between old and new policy
rule systems.

Change-Id: Ibd455be313322472b518434393b3d0b1b1bb860a

WIP: test admin_password with opt out

Be sure legacy users are excluded after we drop the
deprecated fallback. We drop this when admins opt into
the scope check.

Admin password check for project or system scope

This is basically a noop, as all the tested tokens
are either system or project scoped.

TODO:
It would technically block domain scoped tokens,
we should probably test those!

commit_message:
Whitelist the profile_tasks callback by default

This change adds the profile_tasks plugin to our default callback
whitelist which will allow us to collect data on process runtimes
by default.

Change-Id: I44fd6811dab17b78959ed6fe52d2961ea625a04e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff1b07778dc775c16eb4f142375ef06a4656140f)

subject: Overload stdout callback plugin
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-03-02 11:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-03-02 13:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to BACKPORT_TRAIN_VAL_CLI'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2020-03-04 09:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 11:18:43.000000000', 'message': "Overload stdout callback plugin

The stdout callback plugin is being set within ansible runner making it
not respect the user defined configuration. This change adds the required
environment variable after the prepare function to ensure our defined
output callback plugin is always used.

Because we're allowing the assumed output callback plugin to be user defined
we need to cater for parallel playbook execution by defining
`directory_isolation_base_path` in config. Now, whenever parallel playbook
execution is required, `directory_isolation_base_path` will be used ensuring
there are no collisions at runtime.

Change-Id: I7c7e7472d238bd2ab3316cac3dbee01f6d0b10e9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 49d3f725f2be0681b6e761781372782e2514c869)
"}]
commit_message:
Overload stdout callback plugin

The stdout callback plugin is being set within ansible runner making it
not respect the user defined configuration. This change adds the required
environment variable after the prepare function to ensure our defined
output callback plugin is always used.

Because we're allowing the assumed output callback plugin to be user defined
we need to cater for parallel playbook execution by defining
`directory_isolation_base_path` in config. Now, whenever parallel playbook
execution is required, `directory_isolation_base_path` will be used ensuring
there are no collisions at runtime.

Change-Id: I7c7e7472d238bd2ab3316cac3dbee01f6d0b10e9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 49d3f725f2be0681b6e761781372782e2514c869)

[{'created': '2020-03-02 11:18:43.000000000', 'message': 'Replace ansible shell with python runner

This change replaces all of the ansible shell commands with the
python library, ansible-runner. This library is supported by
upstream ansible, is approved by the openstack foundation, is
supported in global requirements, and provides a better, more
programatic interface into running ansible playbooks.

All tests that interacted with the old shell commands have been
updated to now test using the library.

Change-Id: I8db50da826e2fbc074f4e7986d6fd00f6d488648
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit bcc9c667471e832739c20ae06b8325ef95a5e56b)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace ansible shell with python runner

This change replaces all of the ansible shell commands with the
python library, ansible-runner. This library is supported by
upstream ansible, is approved by the openstack foundation, is
supported in global requirements, and provides a better, more
programatic interface into running ansible playbooks.

All tests that interacted with the old shell commands have been
updated to now test using the library.

Change-Id: I8db50da826e2fbc074f4e7986d6fd00f6d488648
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit bcc9c667471e832739c20ae06b8325ef95a5e56b)

commit_message:
Use listen port for Placement precheck

Placement only needs its listen port to be free. During the Placement
split from Nova in commit 2fc6d4cfc5 the wrong variable got moved into
precheck for Placement, this fixes it.

Change-Id: I71e3607c50110763259bfcd70ffb2f4c76e27f62
Closes-Bug: #1861189

commit_message:
Fix incorrect usage of assertRaisesRegex in unit tests

This test passes None instead of a callable, which just happens to
work in Python < 3.9 and breaks in 3.9. Since SessionTimeout is not
actually required, I'm removing the wrong unit test.

Change-Id: I64db7482c4879950dee2b020033d4d1101f61bb6
(cherry picked from commit e5b8c8724edbc334478010214e5829ae8881943e)

subject: Limit prechecks to groups that matter
messages:
[{'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2018-02-01 18:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think some of the prechecks are useful for the deploy group. This includes the service checks, package checks, and user checks. Looking at the new database checks, I think we need to add a when clause to skip these for the deploy group.

The api_interface check shouldn't be running for deploy currently because of this in prechecks/tasks/main.yml:

- include: port_checks.yml
  when: 
    - inventory_hostname in groups['control'] or
      inventory_hostname in groups['network'] or
      inventory_hostname in groups['compute'] or
      inventory_hostname in groups['monitoring']"}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-02-04 11:18:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-02-04 11:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

lgfm'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:24:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Just to clarify, when you say 'deploy', do you mean the ansible control host, or the [deployment] group which runs bifrost?"}, {'account_id': 23327, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-03-30 11:51:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:20:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd like to see an example of specific checks that don't apply to the groups that are being excluded here. In those cases, they could be covered by when clauses in the prechecks role."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-04 09:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: OpenStack-Helm does not require release management
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-04 17:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-02-05 04:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from openstack-helm-is-not-released to project-update'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

That indeeds represents the current situation, and therefore I am willing to mark a positive vote on this, even if I am disappointed. A little change in the commit message would make my code review from negative to positive.

Let me explain my view:

1. I feel it's a terrible mistake to say in our logs that OSH is "continuously released". Helm chart releasing means helm chart versioning, and OSH is not doing that. The commit message should be amended to say that OpenStack-Helm is not following the usual releases processes instead.

2. I strongly believe that most projects should produce releases to be consumed (only a few exceptions should be granted). Therefore, OSH should produce releases. I agree on the fact it would not be traditional releases. For that, we have "release-management: external", which would be a good fit: OSH could put the helm charts on helm hub for example. I can be convinced otherwise. Nevertheless, I would like to see the team's intention here, by having a PTL sign-off that "no release" is indeed the goal they want to have. It's useful for the possible users of OSH to know it in advance.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

In the past when asked, the position was: "we might release in the future", so we kept it as an open thread... But it's been a few releases this way so I think it's safe to say that it's either non-released ('none') or following an external release mechanism ('external').'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-02-06 22:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am no Helm expert but after looking things over I agree that "release-management: external" seems like a better fit.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-07 07:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I am no Helm expert but after looking things over I agree that
 > "release-management: external" seems like a better fit.

I am fine with release-management: none too. I just think it's wrong to say that it's "continuously released" in the commit message, as it sets wrong expectations. I leave it to the PTL to decide whether the team will ever release or not (none or external).'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-10 08:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pete, could you review this, so people can be exposed with your plan for OSH? That would be awesome!'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-25 14:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-25 14:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-26 10:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

Sad to not see a comment from Pete, but okay.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from openstack-helm-is-not-released to project-update'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-02-27 17:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-03-04 08:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
OpenStack-Helm does not require release management

So far OpenStack-Helm has not used release management and is more
continuously released. While that may change in the future, let's
document that for now in governance.

Change-Id: I17878d95f8b005316661d83ec8030c8d626f5800

subject: Guidelines for dropping project teams
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-12 16:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-02-12 16:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-12 17:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh yes good point... I knew I forgot one trigger.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2020-02-12 19:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-13 08:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with you Graham. I think "failure to complete goal" should not be a trigger. But "failure to communicate about goals" should probably be one. 

It's totally acceptable to not be able to complete a goal due to lack of workforce or corner case conditions, as long as you communicate to the goal champion about it. It's less acceptable to be dead silent, or deprioritize reviews of the champion themselves proposing the necessary changes.

Like there is a bunch of projects lagging on the py2-deprecation goal right now, with no clear feedback from them to the champion, which I think should be a trigger.

Finally, there is nothing automatic about this. A TC member still needs to care enough to react to the trigger and start the discussion. It's just a way to set expectations.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-02-13 15:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

(1 comment)

Support the existing comments.  All-in-all think this looks good.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-17 13:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from dropping-projects to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-20 17:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-21 16:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-21 17:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-24 08:18:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Positive on the idea, negative on the wording and the clarity.

it's a step towards the right direction though."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-25 11:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2020-02-25 12:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

I like the new wording, and the clarification about not engaging with the champions clears it up for me'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-02-25 13:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

This is copacetic, I am fine moving forward with it.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-25 15:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-26 10:14:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I have doubts on dependency.

I don't think we should have this, as part of the guideline."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@JP: could you elaborate on your doubts?

The Dependency rule sounds obvious to me: you can't retire a component that has reverse dependencies unless you also retire the dependent components. 

Example: imagine Glance has no Victoria PTL candidate. You can't contemplate retiring Glance (or Neutron, or Keystone) without also retiring Nova. Since Nova is alive and kicking, the TC should find a volunteer for taking Glance over (maintain it as an investment opportunity to get new blood in), rather than propose its retirement.

Dependency (and usage in the wild) are the key elements in deciding whether a given trigger should result in retiring a project or encouraging more resources to step up. If we are not mentioning it, then it's hard to call this "guidelines".'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-26 11:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> @JP: could you elaborate on your doubts?
 > 
 > The Dependency rule sounds obvious to me: you can't retire a
 > component that has reverse dependencies unless you also retire the
 > dependent components.
 > 
 > Example: imagine Glance has no Victoria PTL candidate. You can't
 > contemplate retiring Glance (or Neutron, or Keystone) without also
 > retiring Nova. Since Nova is alive and kicking, the TC should find
 > a volunteer for taking Glance over (maintain it as an investment
 > opportunity to get new blood in), rather than propose its
 > retirement.

Not really. This is a team we are talking about, not only a deliverable.

Let's take an example of what could be done (I am exaggerating here for the sake of the exercise, I don't expect this scenario to happen):
- Glance gets no traction, no folks contributing
- Nova team (let's say Nova is the only team interested in glance's work in this hypothetical case) acquires the glance repos in its team.
- Glance team get retired
- Nova team does whatever it wants with glance repo to make sure things are sustainable for them.

That sounds acceptable to me, but doesn't meet your current criteria, as we couldn't disband it, because the team is marked critical. My concern is only in how people will read this...

 > Dependency (and usage in the wild) are the key elements in deciding
 > whether a given trigger should result in retiring a project or
 > encouraging more resources to step up. If we are not mentioning it,
 > then it's hard to call this "guidelines".

I agree. I think it's a question of wording here.

The fact that a unique team (A) relies on another team's (B) deliverables shouldn't prevent the disbanding of team B. However, if there is a team C also relying on team B's deliverables, then we should probably keep it as a separate team. I can't imagine disbanding oslo team for example.

If we replace "If the project is a dependency of other projects" by "If the project is a dependency of more than a single project", it's already better, though not perfect:
The teams A and C should be able to could discuss together and decide to disband B anyway. I am afraid that the current wording focuses on _who will step up to become the B team" instead of "what are the next steps for a sustainable ecosystem, particularly for teams A and C".'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-26 13:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@JP The case you describe is more akin to a team merge (Nova+Glance=Nova) than a disband. Also this is just guidelines... what should trigger a discussion, and things to consider in making a decision. It is meant to help making a decision, not make a decision by itself. I think the wording ("inquiry", "opportunity", "guidelines") make it clear this is not hard rules.

The main goal here is to explain that some projects are better kept dead than burning out a community member on saving them (where their energy would be better spent on more critical projects).'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-26 13:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In summary, this is just guidelines. The TC decides. You can still disband a team (or merge teams) even if they are critical. You can still keep a team where their deliverable is not used and not a dependency. 

This is just a list of things to consider in making those sorts of calls.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-26 17:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2020-02-27 09:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-02-27 10:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-28 08:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> In summary, this is just guidelines. The TC decides. You can still
 > disband a team (or merge teams) even if they are critical. You can
 > still keep a team where their deliverable is not used and not a
 > dependency.
 > 
 > This is just a list of things to consider in making those sorts of
 > calls.

If everyone reads it like this, it's perfect then."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-28 08:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

ok for me.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-03-04 08:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Guidelines for dropping project teams

During OpenStack history we have added a lot of OpenStack project
teams, and while we have dropped a few along the way, we do not
have a clear set of considerations to take into account in that
process.

In particular, relying purely on activity levels to consider
dropping projects has proved unproductive in the past, as well
as encouraging people to step up for less-strategic abandoned
projects.

Here is a set of guidelines we should use in future such discussions.

Change-Id: I2c798a6d52a2666657dce201a7c02561d2f4d4ed

commit_message:
Add a REST API to disable/enable a flavor.

If a flavor is disabled, it is invisible to tenants while show a list of flavors.
But if a flavor is already associated with instances, a tenants can still access it by the flavor_id.

usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor> <disabled>

Sample request:
REQ: curl -i http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2/770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12
                 -d '{"flavor": {"OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled": true}}

Sample output from CLI:

cloud@devstack:~$ nova help flavor-disabled
usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor_id> <disabled>

Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.

Positional arguments:
  <flavor_id>  flavor id.
  <disabled>   value of disabled (true or false).

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-disabled 12 true
+--------------------------+-------+
| Property                 | Value |
+--------------------------+-------+
| OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled | True  |
| disk                     | 0     |
| extra_specs              | {}    |
| id                       | 12    |
| name                     | test  |
| ram                      | 1024  |
| vcpus                    | 1     |
+--------------------------+-------+

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public | Disabled |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 1    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 12 | test      | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | True     |
| 13 | test1     | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 3  | m1.medium | 4096      | 40   | 0         |      | 2     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 4  | m1.large  | 8192      | 80   | 0         |      | 4     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 42 | m1.nano   | 64        | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 5  | m1.xlarge | 16384     | 160  | 0         |      | 8     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 84 | m1.micro  | 128       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+

Change-Id: I7badf9d402621d6fe32b15ad5264c77e73da1577
Closes-Bug: #1259262

subject: Improve ceph services discovery.
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-03-03 11:28:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-04 00:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-03 11:28:29.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ceph services discovery.

In the upgrade from Rocky to Stein we are required to run
an extra step to migrate the ceph systemd unit files to
work with podman instead of Docker. To know which roles
need this step to be run, this patch improves a little
bit the logic by storing in a enabled_services fact all
the services enabled per role. This allows us to check
later, when creating the templates, if the role we are
creating the templates for has ceph enabled or not.

This change is also useful for the FFWD upgrade from 13
to 16, as the workflow will be almost the same.

Change-Id: I5f4a92587ae5862219f3949bff2f83debf634c5c
(cherry picked from commit 03633459383994d6612b818a2252b9fc4623247f)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve ceph services discovery.

In the upgrade from Rocky to Stein we are required to run
an extra step to migrate the ceph systemd unit files to
work with podman instead of Docker. To know which roles
need this step to be run, this patch improves a little
bit the logic by storing in a enabled_services fact all
the services enabled per role. This allows us to check
later, when creating the templates, if the role we are
creating the templates for has ceph enabled or not.

This change is also useful for the FFWD upgrade from 13
to 16, as the workflow will be almost the same.

Change-Id: I5f4a92587ae5862219f3949bff2f83debf634c5c
(cherry picked from commit 03633459383994d6612b818a2252b9fc4623247f)

commit_message:
Alter readme path for collect logs

Right the readme.html to be copied to the base directory, is
hardcoded to tripleo-ci documentation. In order to other
projects be able to use their own readme, we need to be able
to set it.
This path add a artcl_readme_path to do so.

Change-Id: I87688444c019b67467ecbd4d153269ba8d1f154f

[{'created': '2020-01-14 21:03:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add availability_zone attribute to gnocchi instance resources.

Since moving to libvirt nova-compute poller we no longer have
the availability_zone attribute of an instance available.

We can capture instance.create.end events and create gnocchi resources
based on these which do have the availability_zone availabile.

Currently we are only handling delete events for resources, this
patch adds the handling of create events for this purpose.

Change-Id: Ieddbddd4ddb6af11d5158f5c90c87ae4f847bb96
(cherry picked from commit 21a810fec6bbf19584cad7aa5aff59ecea826907)
'}]
commit_message:
Add availability_zone attribute to gnocchi instance resources.

Since moving to libvirt nova-compute poller we no longer have
the availability_zone attribute of an instance available.

We can capture instance.create.end events and create gnocchi resources
based on these which do have the availability_zone availabile.

Currently we are only handling delete events for resources, this
patch adds the handling of create events for this purpose.

Change-Id: Ieddbddd4ddb6af11d5158f5c90c87ae4f847bb96
(cherry picked from commit 21a810fec6bbf19584cad7aa5aff59ecea826907)

commit_message:
Set instance_type_id in event traits to be a string.

In gnocchi the flavor_id attribute is a string so also make it a
string in the event for compatibility.

This is needed if you are creating gnocchi instances from events.

Change-Id: I1949e592431510b0cb6949e981f3efb72a1e7a1a
(cherry picked from commit db3fcc02eeec1a973629cf23219efe9ff744be09)

commit_message:
Fix up some Content-Type handling in account/container listings

Update content type on 204 (not just 200) to properly handle HEAD
requests from xml/txt listings.

Add "Vary: Accept" header to listings, since otherwise, browsers may
serve the wrong content type from cache (even though we *would have*
sent the *right* type if it actually sent the request).

Change-Id: Iaa333aaca36a8dc2df65d38ef2173e3a6e2000ee

@Jay Bryant The 3rd part CI is happy now. Could you have a code view again?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-24 15:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

This is basically fine, and it looks like the 3rd party CI is happy.  (Don't worry, my -1 will be a quick change.)

Three things:

1. Sean pointed this out on PS8, namely that the driver is still marked 'unsupported' (lines 113-114 in cinder/volume/drivers/fusionstorage/dsware.py).  I'm open to other ideas, but I think I'd like to see this patch be a straightforward revert (so, basically everything you've got here, except do not add the new release note).

2. Then put up a patch marking the driver 'supported' and include the new release note on *that* patch.

3. Another follow-up is to revert e010634fb96e5dea3484015bd2f3fd02609fcd9f.  I think this would be good as a straight revert, that is, don't include the release note or marking the driver supported with this.

So we need something to connect these three things.  I just filed a blueprint for this [0], so what you can do is in the commit message for each of 1-3, add "Partially Implements: blueprint restore-fusionstorage-driver", and that will make the connection.  (And if there's anything we forgot, we can add it to the blueprint later.)

[0] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/restore-fusionstorage-driver'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-25 16:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Revert "Remove Huawei FusionStorage Driver"

This reverts commit 120e3f31ecd3925878c2f0c13988cddcd21729ab.

Minor adjustments needed to account for import order enforcement
introduced after driver removal.

Change-Id: I02064f7911ef30a2ce1e0bd62fffc8777b4c988f

commit_message:
Add stestr to test-requirements

We have relied on oslotest pulling in stestr so far. That will no longer
happen, so this adds an explicit requirement for getting stestr
installed.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/012973.html

Change-Id: Ie7de62ceccc52a1c291ba8ffdccc8a2013d5a43d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: We need to use the MAC instead of PCI Address for Mellanox cards
messages: [{'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2020-03-02 21:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2020-03-02 21:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-03 21:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 21:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'We need to use the MAC instead of PCI Address for Mellanox cards

Since Mellanox cards are already bound, they are not added
to the dpdk mapping file. The set devargs command is never run.

This patch ensures that get_dpdk_devargs returns the devargs,
even on newer Mellanox interfaces.

Change-Id: I6f4c3716c7ee74d7bd2c48e598e5c6de4332d726
Closes-Bug: 1862298
(cherry picked from commit 11d9a23600e43de0071f05e716ec6f7e1ee80670)
'}]
commit_message:
We need to use the MAC instead of PCI Address for Mellanox cards

Since Mellanox cards are already bound, they are not added
to the dpdk mapping file. The set devargs command is never run.

This patch ensures that get_dpdk_devargs returns the devargs,
even on newer Mellanox interfaces.

Change-Id: I6f4c3716c7ee74d7bd2c48e598e5c6de4332d726
Closes-Bug: 1862298
(cherry picked from commit 11d9a23600e43de0071f05e716ec6f7e1ee80670)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 12:07:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ping loss detection

Packet loss detection worked not correct when percentage was lower
than 1% (e.g. 0.172282%). This caused not relevant fails of upgrade
jobs in CI. See example below:

5224 packets transmitted, 5215 received, 0.172282% packet loss, time 5570ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.398/0.801/14.855/0.449 ms
Ping loss higher than 1% detected

Change-Id: Ief3fb1d22fc6b69d79b8b28ec8e986437f456e80
(cherry picked from commit 6ecf38c4edc4cd50050103334274300c0af4bc9c)
(cherry picked from commit 4de17fde3f50d2c9c7c8b2b41bccf8d76ecec87d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ping loss detection

Packet loss detection worked not correct when percentage was lower
than 1% (e.g. 0.172282%). This caused not relevant fails of upgrade
jobs in CI. See example below:

5224 packets transmitted, 5215 received, 0.172282% packet loss, time 5570ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.398/0.801/14.855/0.449 ms
Ping loss higher than 1% detected

Change-Id: Ief3fb1d22fc6b69d79b8b28ec8e986437f456e80
(cherry picked from commit 6ecf38c4edc4cd50050103334274300c0af4bc9c)
(cherry picked from commit 4de17fde3f50d2c9c7c8b2b41bccf8d76ecec87d)

Change-Id: If9488d7c60b58f51a7a0a4bdf0740d16f61c241e

commit_message:
Move stackviz publish in-tree

The new job publish-openstack-stackviz-element is working now,
move the trigger in-tree and change the publish location, we do not need
the "-new" in the name anymore.

Content is published at:
https://tarballs.opendev.org/openstack/stackviz/dist/
The tarballs are equal, only difference is filenames of sources.

Mark the job to run only on master, since it publishes always to the
same location and each invocation overrides the file. This is a
safety measure.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/710754
Change-Id: If9488d7c60b58f51a7a0a4bdf0740d16f61c241e

commit_message:
Remove site_specs and playbooks/publish/service-types.yaml

playbooks/publish/service-types.yaml is not used anymore, with AFS
publishing it got obsoleted and can now be removed.

site_specs and site_specs_promote are not used anymore, remove them.

Change-Id: I0c3ca2455b4f8b721d48d44780dbc397ddc9cb20

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 19:40:40.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from mock to unittest.mock use

The mock library is a third party lib that attempted to bridge the gap
between Python 2 and Python 3 mocking. Now that we have moved to py3
only, there is no need to use a third party lib and we can use the
standard built-in mocking support.

Change-Id: I8bbcedb7ad3f0bc2e06dfa13878a97411ee1dc6d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from mock to unittest.mock use

The mock library is a third party lib that attempted to bridge the gap
between Python 2 and Python 3 mocking. Now that we have moved to py3
only, there is no need to use a third party lib and we can use the
standard built-in mocking support.

Change-Id: I8bbcedb7ad3f0bc2e06dfa13878a97411ee1dc6d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/663382/6 : SUCCESS in 2h 32m 34s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-14 20:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The last time I looked at this there were questions about how to recreate it [1] and Stephen didn't really seem to have a solid recreate scenario.

mdbooth seems to be suggesting a concurrent delete request in the API could trigger the fault during spawn. Can we recreate that in a functional test doing something like:

1. create an instance but stub something out during the spawn process
2. delete the server via an API call
3. resume the spawn which should fail
4. assert we cleanup networking properly

Given how latent this issue is and especially if it's dealing with concurrent operations, I'd like to see a functional recreate test if possible so we have proper code coverage since unit tests for these kinds of fixes usually just mirror the code change to say "yup it's doing what it was written to do".

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663382/4/nova/compute/manager.py@2506'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-10-14 21:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

i had complete unloaded the context for this but
im pretty sure if we stub out _update_instance_after_spawn
to call the api and do the delete via the api here

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d14ae3a126cf0fdcc7e81ad27eec2532f020f20b/nova/compute/manager.py#L2551

and wait for the task state to change to deleting
then when we retrun form _update_instance_after_spawn and call

instance.save(expected_task_state=task_states.SPAWNING)

which will raise the UnexpectedDeletingTaskStateError exception wihc is handeled an reaised here

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d14ae3a126cf0fdcc7e81ad27eec2532f020f20b/nova/compute/manager.py#L2555-L2564

which is where the "Expected: {'task_state': [u'spawning']}. Actual: {'task_state': u'deleting'} notify_about_instance_usage ..." came form in the customer log

this reraised exception eventualy hits 
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a9b4f2cd33ae03881aa3e340cd68054bc46bb6b4/nova/compute/manager.py#L1933-L1939

but we dont do 

self.network_api.cleanup_instance_network_on_host(
context, instance, self.host)

like we do here
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/19.0.0/nova/compute/manager.py#L2010-L2015

so we leak the vifs.

this chagne moves the cleanup_instance_network_on_host call into 
_cleanup_allocated_networks

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663382/6/nova/compute/manager.py

so that it is now handeled correctly.


so we should be able to recreate it in a functional test as matt sugges by mocking _update_instance_after_spawn to call the api to delete and wait for the task state to chagne to deleting  and then simply in the test try to create a server.

then if we mock cleanup_instance_network_on_host we shoudl be able to assert that without sthepens change it is not called and with it it is.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-10-17 21:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-17 22:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 17:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Unplug VIFs as part of cleanup of networks

If an instance fails to build, which is possible for a variety of
reasons, we may end up in a situation where we have remnants of a
plugged VIF (typically files) left of the host. This is because we
cleanup from the neutron perspective but don't attempt to unplug the
VIF, a call which may have many side-effects depending on the VIF
driver. Resolve this by always attempting to unplug VIFs as part of the
network cleanup.

A now invalid note is also removed and a unit test corrected.

Change-Id: Ibdbde4ed460a99b0cbe0d6b76e0e5b3c0650f9d9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1831771

commit_message:
Unplug VIFs as part of cleanup of networks

If an instance fails to build, which is possible for a variety of
reasons, we may end up in a situation where we have remnants of a
plugged VIF (typically files) left on the host. This is because we
cleanup from the neutron perspective but don't attempt to unplug the
VIF, a call which may have many side-effects depending on the VIF
driver. Resolve this by always attempting to unplug VIFs as part of the
network cleanup.

A now invalid note is also removed and a unit test corrected.

Closes-Bug: #1831771
Related-Bug: #1830081
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibdbde4ed460a99b0cbe0d6b76e0e5b3c0650f9d9

commit_message:
Remove devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest py2 job

devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest is py2 job and not
supposed to run on master gate. Moving
devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3 from experimental pipeline
to check.

Change-Id: I8a15d919f9902315c4a8d27d73dabbcc5be8d8de

subject: HA: reorder init_bundle and restart_bundle for improved updates
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-02-14 21:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-02-14 21:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-03 09:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-03-03 14:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-14 21:01:11.000000000', 'message': 'HA: reorder init_bundle and restart_bundle for improved updates

A pacemaker bundle can be restarted either because:
  . a tripleo config has been updated (from /var/lib/config-data)
  . the bundle config has been updated (container image, bundle
    parameter,...)

In HA services, special container "*_restart_bundle" is in charge
of restarting the HA service on tripleo config change. Special
container "*_init_bundle" handles restart on bundle config change.

When both types of change occur at the same time, the bundle must
be restarted first, so that the container has a chance to be
recreated with all bind-mounts updated before it tries to reload
the updated config.

Implement the improvement with two changes:

1. Make the "*_restart_bundle" start after the "*_init_bundle", and
make sure "*_restart_bundle" is only enabled after the initial
deployment.

2. During minor update, make sure that the "*_restart_bundle" not
only restarts the container, but also waits until the service
is operational (e.g. galera fully promoted to Master). This forces
the rolling restart to happen sequentially, and avoid service
disruption in quorum-based clustered services like galera and
rabbitmq.

Tested the following update use cases:

* minor update: ensure that *_restart_bundle restarts all types of
  resources (OCF, bundles, A/P, A/P Master/Slave).

* minor update: ensure *_restart_bundle is not executed when no
  config or image update happened for a service.

* restart_bundle: when resource (OCF or container) fails to
  restart, bail out early instead of waiting for nothing until
  timeout is reached.

* restart_bundle: make sure a resource is restarted even when it
  is in failed stated when *_restart_bundle is called.

* restart_bundle: A/P can be restarted on any node, so watch
  restart globally. When the resource restarts as Slave, continue
  watching for a Master elsewhere in the cluster.

* restart_bundle: if an A/P is not running locally, make sure it
  doesn't get restarted anywhere else in the cluster.

* restart_bundle: do not try to restart stopped (disabled) or
  unmanaged resource. Bail out early instead, to not wait until
  timeout is reached.

* stack update: make sure that running a stack update with no
  change does not trigger any *_restart_bundle, and does not
  restart any HA container either.

* stack update: when bundle and config will change, ensure bundle
  is updated before HA containers are restarted (e.g. HAProxy
  migration to TLS everywhere)

Change-Id: Ic41d4597e9033f9d7847bb6c10c25f443fbd5b0e
Closes-Bug: #1839858
(cherry picked from commit 3230f005c1d51863a2c2484fe4c05471f5dc25dc)

2. During minor update, make sure that the "*_restart_bundle" not
only restarts the container, but also waits until the service
is operational (e.g. galera fully promoted to Master). This forces
the rolling restart to happen sequentially, and avoid service
disruption in quorum-based clustered services like galera and

Tested the following update use cases:

* minor update: ensure that *_restart_bundle restarts all types of
  resources (OCF, bundles, A/P, A/P Master/Slave).

* minor update: ensure *_restart_bundle is not executed when no
  config or image update happened for a service.

* restart_bundle: when resource (OCF or container) fails to
  restart, bail out early instead of waiting for nothing until
  timeout is reached.

* restart_bundle: make sure a resource is restarted even when it
  is in failed stated when *_restart_bundle is called.

* restart_bundle: A/P can be restarted on any node, so watch
  restart globally. When the resource restarts as Slave, continue

* restart_bundle: if an A/P is not running locally, make sure it
  doesn't get restarted anywhere else in the cluster.

* restart_bundle: do not try to restart stopped (disabled) or
  unmanaged resource. Bail out early instead, to not wait until
  timeout is reached.

* stack update: make sure that running a stack update with no
  change does not trigger any *_restart_bundle, and does not
  restart any HA container either.

* stack update: when bundle and config will change, ensure bundle
  is updated before HA containers are restarted (e.g. HAProxy
  migration to TLS everywhere)

Change-Id: Ic41d4597e9033f9d7847bb6c10c25f443fbd5b0e
Closes-Bug: #1839858
(cherry picked from commit 3230f005c1d51863a2c2484fe4c05471f5dc25dc)
'}]
commit_message:
HA: reorder init_bundle and restart_bundle for improved updates

A pacemaker bundle can be restarted either because:
  . a tripleo config has been updated (from /var/lib/config-data)
  . the bundle config has been updated (container image, bundle
    parameter,...)

In HA services, special container "*_restart_bundle" is in charge
of restarting the HA service on tripleo config change. Special
container "*_init_bundle" handles restart on bundle config change.

When both types of change occur at the same time, the bundle must
be restarted first, so that the container has a chance to be
recreated with all bind-mounts updated before it tries to reload
the updated config.

Implement the improvement with two changes:

1. Make the "*_restart_bundle" start after the "*_init_bundle", and
make sure "*_restart_bundle" is only enabled after the initial
deployment.

2. During minor update, make sure that the "*_restart_bundle" not
only restarts the container, but also waits until the service
is operational (e.g. galera fully promoted to Master). This forces
the rolling restart to happen sequentially, and avoid service
disruption in quorum-based clustered services like galera and
rabbitmq.

Tested the following update use cases:

* minor update: ensure that *_restart_bundle restarts all types of
  resources (OCF, bundles, A/P, A/P Master/Slave).

* minor update: ensure *_restart_bundle is not executed when no
  config or image update happened for a service.

* restart_bundle: when resource (OCF or container) fails to
  restart, bail out early instead of waiting for nothing until
  timeout is reached.

* restart_bundle: make sure a resource is restarted even when it
  is in failed stated when *_restart_bundle is called.

* restart_bundle: A/P can be restarted on any node, so watch
  restart globally. When the resource restarts as Slave, continue
  watching for a Master elsewhere in the cluster.

* restart_bundle: if an A/P is not running locally, make sure it
  doesn't get restarted anywhere else in the cluster.

* restart_bundle: do not try to restart stopped (disabled) or
  unmanaged resource. Bail out early instead, to not wait until
  timeout is reached.

* stack update: make sure that running a stack update with no
  change does not trigger any *_restart_bundle, and does not
  restart any HA container either.

* stack update: when bundle and config will change, ensure bundle
  is updated before HA containers are restarted (e.g. HAProxy
  migration to TLS everywhere)

Change-Id: Ic41d4597e9033f9d7847bb6c10c25f443fbd5b0e
Closes-Bug: #1839858
(cherry picked from commit 3230f005c1d51863a2c2484fe4c05471f5dc25dc)

[{'created': '2020-02-25 01:54:33.000000000', 'message': 'Do not initialize snat-ns twice

If the DVR+HA router has external gateway, the snat-namespace will be
initialized twice during agent restart. And that ns initialization
function will run many external resource processing actions which will
definitely increase the starting time of L3 agent. This patch addresses
this issue.

Change-Id: I7719491275fa1ebfa7e881366e5cb066e3d4185c
Closes-Bug: #1850779
(cherry picked from commit 7a9d6d26419defa148764166600bc4ac6b50c109)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not initialize snat-ns twice

If the DVR+HA router has external gateway, the snat-namespace will be
initialized twice during agent restart. And that ns initialization
function will run many external resource processing actions which will
definitely increase the starting time of L3 agent. This patch addresses
this issue.

Change-Id: I7719491275fa1ebfa7e881366e5cb066e3d4185c
Closes-Bug: #1850779
(cherry picked from commit 7a9d6d26419defa148764166600bc4ac6b50c109)

commit_message:
Increase number of retries for container create async task

Seems like some db_sync tasks are taking more time and this
results in jobs failing. Though probably not a long
term solution, would be good to increase it to reduce the
large number of job failures.

Change-Id: Ifa494ffdd58772c39808bcaa3d5d37b3802af065
Ralated-Bug: #1865473

commit_message:
libvirt: remove unused cpuset_cpus

cpuset_cpus was useful for Docker containers but not anymore with
Podman.

Change-Id: I37fce2d4418f450f734924db828fb981660fdef3

commit_message:
Revert "Explicitly set LOCALE_PATHS for Horizon apps"

This reverts commit 4e911e2889ebe7f0a577a0323649dceb9cef363c.

We don't need this change on the latest master. I'm unable to reproduce
an original bug without this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1834167
Change-Id: Iaffdb64fb0bc58525554ac9d40d2aeadb0876ffd

subject: Adds heartbeating to the consul driver.
messages:
[{'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-02-13 16:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-18 08:59:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hello,

Thanks for these changes, they looks fine, I just have some suggestions and changes requested.

First, in your previous abandoned patch [1] you spoke about a tenacity log issue, I suppose it correspond to this code [2], what's the related issue you found? is it still an issue?

AFAIK these changes seems to make sense [3].

Concerning the maximum returned `sleep_sec` it seems okay to me.

Consul driver don't seem to have related tests so is not easy to introduce related tests to your changes.

Please add a related release note `fix` [4] to inform users concerning these changes.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/648557/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tooz/blob/a4f1288ee4234865a4db8b9c191ba275e2deef3d/tooz/coordination.py#L184,L186
[3] https://python-consul.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#consul.base.Consul.Session.renew
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/"}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-02-18 13:06:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Herve,

Thanks for the review! I'll try to answer your questions in order:

- Tenacity log issue: This seems to have been resolved by someone else. The changes i made  are present in the current master branch, so no changes needed on my end after i rebased.

- I will work on adding release notes.

Thanks,
Nick"}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-02-18 13:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-02-18 14:55:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Is there a way to restart these tests? Looks like one timed out and i'm not sure how to bump it."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-18 14:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-02-18 15:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-02-18 17:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hervé,

Any advice on the etd3 test timing out?

I tried doing a force push to see if i could get the build to pass, but no luck.

[{'created': '2020-02-25 22:34:29.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder backup export broken

Incremental patch I516b7c82b05b26e81195f7f106d43a9e0804082d
introduced a regression, breaking the volume backup export
functionality.

Apparently, the newly introduced "parent" db field isn't
serialized properly.

This is the traceback from the launchpad bug:
oslo_versionedobjects.exception.ObjectActionError:
Object action obj_load_attr failed because: attribute
parent not lazy-loadable

Looking at the traceback, and the Backup OVO code it seems
like we have 2 problems:

- We don't support lazy loading the parent
- We try to serialize the parent

Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I017602353e96cf9f0922074f94276002b17d1359
Closes-Bug: #1862635
(cherry picked from commit a98969380ac2172766995cf02b889e3c863511ba)

cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_backup.py - pyflake issue #202
(cherry picked from commit 6dfbec7f7403bbbe498c5eaba16b5b68bd7d698c)

commit_message:
Cinder backup export broken

Incremental patch I516b7c82b05b26e81195f7f106d43a9e0804082d
introduced a regression, breaking the volume backup export
functionality.

Apparently, the newly introduced "parent" db field isn't
serialized properly.

This is the traceback from the launchpad bug:
oslo_versionedobjects.exception.ObjectActionError:
Object action obj_load_attr failed because: attribute
parent not lazy-loadable

Looking at the traceback, and the Backup OVO code it seems
like we have 2 problems:

- We don't support lazy loading the parent
- We try to serialize the parent

Co-Authored-By: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I017602353e96cf9f0922074f94276002b17d1359
Closes-Bug: #1862635
(cherry picked from commit a98969380ac2172766995cf02b889e3c863511ba)
modified:
cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_backup.py - pyflake issue #202
(cherry picked from commit 6dfbec7f7403bbbe498c5eaba16b5b68bd7d698c)
(cherry picked from commit 196b6786db82de5afcaed2790395d869a7c2c183)

subject: Final Cinder team releases for stable/rocky
messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-22 15:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-22 15:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Waiting on Change-Id: I017602353e96cf9f0922074f94276002b17d1359 to be backported to cinder before releasing.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-25 22:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Update: we're waiting for Change-Id: I017602353e96cf9f0922074f94276002b17d1359 to merge to stable/rocky for cinder."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-26 18:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-26 21:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck

Not sure why the failures are happening. Reno fixes should be in for cinder and the commit hash looks right for python-cinderclient.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-26 23:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The first failure of openstack-tox-validate was different, but the last 2 have been during processing cinder.yaml -- "ValueError: '2014.2' is not in list" in job-output.txt'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-28 22:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Issue appears to be in the "Ensure the version numbers are valid" step of the validation. We are checked out the the commit specified in the hash, but then the script checks out the previous tag. The issue then is the code from the previous tag does not have the new reno config file that tells reno to stop scanning the history at the point where cinder started using reno, so it goes back further and hits the issue with the older 2014.2 release.

Investigating what we are trying to do in that part of the validation that we think we need to checkout the code to the earlier tag and run "python3 setup.py sdist" on it.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-28 23:10:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So here's what I've found. As part of validating the version number is OK, we have a check to see if there are any requirements changes being done one a bugfix only bump. That calls here:

https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/openstack_releases/requirements.py#L30

Which ends up trying to create an sdist in order to extract its requirements information here:

https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/openstack_releases/requirements.py#L30

That of course fails, because we didn't have the reno fix in the last version.

I will look at any ways around that, but in the meantime, since we have the space we can actually do a minor version bump here. That will cause this requirements check to be skipped:

https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/b45e3395b24acf1d2d6103beeb2da421e1e72cac/openstack_releases/requirements.py#L35

The included changes are only bugfixes, so it doesn't quite warrant a minor version bump. Then again, RBD incremental backups actually working is sort of a new feature. ;)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-28 23:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-29 11:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-29 14:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-03-02 20:13:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This is basically the same as PS2, so it works for me.  (Sean's patch to the tooling https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710538/ makes it unnecessary to change the version number for the release.)"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-03 08:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-03-03 21:07:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Note to release cores: this won't merge until https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710538/ has merged."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-28 23:17:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail version validation on install failure

There could be an issue in previous tagged releases due to external
factors. In that case, there is no way to fix that version.

Validation currently checks out the previous tag and creates an sdist in
order to compare requirements changes on bugfix version bumps only. In
the case where the previous release has an issue, just handle the
failure and move along.

Change-Id: I60db41a475c3a13359556198c0611489dffa4b3f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-02-29 11:33:30.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail version validation on install failure

There could be an issue in previous tagged releases due to external
factors. In that case, there is no way to fix that version.

Validation currently checks out the previous tag and creates an sdist in
order to compare requirements changes on bugfix version bumps only. In
the case where the previous release has an issue, just handle the
failure and move along.

Change-Id: I60db41a475c3a13359556198c0611489dffa4b3f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't fail version validation on install failure

There could be an issue in previous tagged releases due to external
factors. In that case, there is no way to fix that version.

Validation currently checks out the previous tag and creates an sdist in
order to compare requirements changes on bugfix version bumps only. In
the case where the previous release has an issue, just handle the
failure and move along.

Change-Id: I60db41a475c3a13359556198c0611489dffa4b3f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Rally] Add clean up script to neutron

Rally can leave behind rally-generated network and router in the neutron
helm test. This patch set adds in a clean up script to clean up these
rally-generated resources.

Change-Id: If7dc9e4e5a659657e8a7e32f6d94703992dcd193
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
