commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ie6d4d5d86006dfa39645ff072b33a7471e10fc01

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ic9587fda5e2ba04ef151c32706b8da04a04096d4

commit_message:
Release 'mistral-extra' 10.0.0 and 'mistral' ussuri-2

* 'mistral-extra' has now been made a separate deliverable and
  immediately released under version 10.0.0
* 'mistral' ussuri-2 has been released w/o 'mistral-extra' in it

Change-Id: Ie3d696c6af62776fbc4fd5c715af3dae8d97c200

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

openstack-ansible repos need few updates on requirements
and tox file.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ic6cb1eb547efa7cda472950a49dd8adbd7760ffe

[{'created': '2020-03-01 15:14:13.000000000', 'message': 'Do not create temporary swift URLS for ceph-ansible

The state information in the ceph-ansible fetch directory
is no longer necessary to replace a Ceph monitor as of
ceph-ansible 4.0.14-1. Stein, Train, Ussuri and newer
should be using this version of ceph-ansible or newer.
TripleO does not need to do extra work to maintain the
fetch directory.

This means that the plan_management workbook no longer
needs to create the SwiftFetchDirGetTempurl and the
SwiftFetchDirPutTempurl parameters. This patch removes
the create_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory_backup_plan
task which creates them. It also removes the workbook
rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.

Both Icce658f803a608ee4b7df34b0b8297ecabcdb0ee and
Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d are effectively
reverted of their ceph aspects with this change, but this
change should not be backported to Rocky or older because
ceph-ansible 3 still needs the fetch directory.

Change-Id: I167449e4d7e38f0f5fd74251a3bd8f5b0b31451b
Related-Bug: #1863809
(cherry picked from commit a54dc49bba9b31cf16416f6478d0f784b6503a9a)

Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d are effectively

commit_message:
Do not create temporary swift URLS for ceph-ansible

The state information in the ceph-ansible fetch directory
is no longer necessary to replace a Ceph monitor as of
ceph-ansible 4.0.14-1. Stein, Train, Ussuri and newer
should be using this version of ceph-ansible or newer.
TripleO does not need to do extra work to maintain the
fetch directory.

This means that the plan_management workbook no longer
needs to create the SwiftFetchDirGetTempurl and the
SwiftFetchDirPutTempurl parameters. This patch removes
the create_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory_backup_plan
task which creates them. It also removes the workbook
rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.

Both Icce658f803a608ee4b7df34b0b8297ecabcdb0ee and
Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d are effectively
reverted of their ceph aspects with this change, but this
change should not be backported to Rocky or older because
ceph-ansible 3 still needs the fetch directory.

Unlclean cherry pick; required manual changes.

Change-Id: I167449e4d7e38f0f5fd74251a3bd8f5b0b31451b
Related-Bug: #1863809
(cherry picked from commit a54dc49bba9b31cf16416f6478d0f784b6503a9a)

commit_message:
Add QA upstream contribution opportunity

The OpenStack QA team is in need of additional contributors.  This
document aims to explain the business case for an enterprise to assign
an engineer to contribute to QA.

Change-Id: Ib7438bcbd49e4ca99869377ab34ca17e27f769f7

[{'created': '2020-02-17 18:41:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing evacuate policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin role
- policy check fail with context having any other role than admin

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh [1], to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.
When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing evacuate policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing evacuate policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin role
- policy check fail with context having any other role than admin

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh [1], to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.
When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing evacuate policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#testing

Change-Id: Ia1e43efc418fdfb0a9f0e3c024fc4ddf5193628c

Use ipc:host for cinder-backup

cinder-backup container but not in the non-pacemaker version.

[{'created': '2020-02-20 13:22:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix timeseries in redfish parser

While trying to enable the redfish job in the CI we found:
`Duplicated timeseries in CollectorRegistry: {'baremetal_fan_status'}`,
this is due to the fact that  we were creating multiple `Gauge` for
the metric and Prometheus does not support this.

We should pre-create the Gauge and update with the different sets of
labels and values that were collected.

Change-Id: I4f4ea8e580ccb439afa7c8e14fabb94c2d124b17
(cherry picked from commit 23a9cd947188fc7d675dbc1ddb105a4c26e88f3e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix timeseries in redfish parser

While trying to enable the redfish job in the CI we found:
`Duplicated timeseries in CollectorRegistry: {'baremetal_fan_status'}`,
this is due to the fact that  we were creating multiple `Gauge` for
the metric and Prometheus does not support this.

We should pre-create the Gauge and update with the different sets of
labels and values that were collected.

Change-Id: I4f4ea8e580ccb439afa7c8e14fabb94c2d124b17
(cherry picked from commit 23a9cd947188fc7d675dbc1ddb105a4c26e88f3e)

The latest build doesn't look like it even got to building ovn. Back on patchset 16, we can see that ovn-nb.ovsschema gets installed to /usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-nb.ovsschema.

2020-01-21 17:49:47.578875 | controller |  /usr/bin/install -c -m 644 vswitchd/vswitch.ovsschema vtep/vtep.ovsschema ovn/ovn-sb.ovsschema ovn/ovn-nb.ovsschema '/usr/share/openvswitch'

The patch I have here https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703883/1/ovsdbapp/venv.py looks like it should handle it, but didn't want to presume to Depends-On it myself in case you were in the middle of making changes."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-01-23 04:34:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

Actually, it looks like the page was just slow loading when I was searching, the last one did build ovs :) That said, the schema is still at /usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-nb.ovsschema and it is being passed to ovsdb-tool as /usr/local/share/ovn/ovn-sb.ovsschema.

It looks like despite the Depends-On: that we might be overwriting ovsdbapp with version 0.18.0. Not sure if I'm reading that right, but if so that might explain things not working. If Depends-On does work,  I still think the patch at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703883 should fix this--mostly because it removes the incorrect 'ovn/' subdir in the ovnsb_schema and ovnnb_schema properties, e.g.: 
  path = os.path.join(self.ovsdir, 'ovn', 'ovn-sb.ovsschema'). In any case we're going to need an ovsdbapp release.

If it doesn't, then adding an argument to _share_path to check isfile() on a schema to make sure that we don't have an empty directory hanging around w/o schema files in it should probably do the trick. My apologies for the rambling. It's been a long day. :p"}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-01-23 10:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

_get_install_share_path() it may be nice to change this to be similar to what is done in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703883/1/ovsdbapp/venv.py  for sake of consistency.'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2020-01-23 11:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-01-23 13:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

  * base

  * ovn mechanism driver
  * impl_idl
  * maintenance task
and needed resources to run the tests.

This patch adds OVN functional tests.

This patch adds deployement of murano-dashboard to horizon,
once `horizon_enable_murano_ui` variable is set to True.

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-availability-zone

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-availability-zone API policies
as:
- 'system' for detail AZ which has host info
- ['system', 'project'] for list AZ.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh
